Package org.dark.shaders.distortion

Class WaveDistortion

java.lang.Object
org.dark.shaders.distortion.WaveDistortion
All Implemented Interfaces:
DistortionAPI
public class WaveDistortion extends Object implements DistortionAPI
A general-use wave-shaped distortion object. This type of distortion is suitable for many common situations where a more precise effect is not needed. This distortion is a radial "pop-out" that does not skew textures.

Since:
Alpha 1.1

  • Method Details

    • advance

      public boolean advance(float amount)
      Runs once per frame.

      Specified by:
      advance in interface DistortionAPI
      Parameters:
      amount - Seconds since last frame.

      Returns:
      True if the distortion object should be destroyed this frame, false if it should not be destroyed this frame.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • fadeInIntensity

      public void fadeInIntensity(float time)
      Sets the distortion's intensity to zero and fades in the distortion's intensity to its original value over a period of time.

      Parameters:
      time - The time over which to fade in the distortion's intensity.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • fadeInSize

      public void fadeInSize(float time)
      Sets the distortion's size to zero and fades in the distortion's size to its original value over a period of time.

      Parameters:
      time - The time over which to fade in the distortion's size.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • fadeOutIntensity

      public void fadeOutIntensity(float time)
      Fades out the distortion's intensity over a period of time. If the distortion hits zero intensity, it is destroyed. Negative time values will cause the intensity to increase forever.

      Parameters:
      time - The time over which to fade out the distortion's intensity.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • fadeOutSize

      public void fadeOutSize(float time)
      Fades out the distortion's size over a period of time. If the distortion hits zero size, it is destroyed. Negative time values will cause the size to increase forever.

      Parameters:
      time - The time over which to fade out the distortion's size.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • flip

      public void flip(boolean flipped)
      Sets whether the distortion should be flipped in magnitude. This simulates the effect of performing a horizontal-vertical inversion of the red and green color channels. For example, if the distortion normally looks like a sphere, it will instead look like a spherical hole.

      Parameters:
      flipped - Whether the magnitude should be flipped.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • getArcAttenuationWidth

      public float getArcAttenuationWidth()
      The width of the visible arc's edge attenuation, in degrees. Wider attenuation will make the transition smoother.

      Specified by:
      getArcAttenuationWidth in interface DistortionAPI
      Returns:
      The width of the visible arc's edge attenuation, in degrees.

      Since:
      Beta 1.0

    • setArcAttenuationWidth

      public void setArcAttenuationWidth(float width)
      Sets the width of the visible arc's edge attenuation, in degrees. Wider attenuation will make the transition smoother.

      Parameters:
      width - The desired width of the visible arc's edge attenuation, in degrees.

      Since:
      Beta 1.0

    • getArcEnd

      public float getArcEnd()
      The end of the current visible arc of the distortion, in degrees. Note: the entire shader is visible if the arc spans 0 degrees.

      Specified by:
      getArcEnd in interface DistortionAPI
      Returns:
      The current facing direction of the distortion.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.11

    • getFacing

      public float getFacing()
      The current facing direction of the distortion, in degrees. Matches sprite's rotation.

      Specified by:
      getFacing in interface DistortionAPI
      Returns:
      The current facing direction of the distortion.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • getIntensity

      public float getIntensity()
      Returns the world-space quantity, in units, to distort by at the maximum distortion level (blue channel at 255). The distortion engine will handle the transformation for you. Note that this function refers to the intensity scale of the distortion texture, not its size. Modify the texture's sprite directly to change its size directly.

      Specified by:
      getIntensity in interface DistortionAPI
      Returns:
      The scaling factor to transform the blue channel by, in world space units.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • setIntensity

      public void setIntensity(float intensity)
      Sets the world-space quantity, in units, to distort by at the maximum distortion level (blue channel at 255). The distortion engine will handle the transformation for you. Note that this function refers to the intensity scale of the distortion texture, not its size. Modify the texture's sprite directly to change its size directly.

      Parameters:
      intensity - The scaling factor to transform the blue channel by, in world space units.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • setLifetime

      public void setLifetime(float lifetime)
      Sets the time the distortion has before it expires. Lifetime does not count down while the distortion is fading (in or out). After reaching the end of its lifetime, the distortion may fade out before disappearing if it has AutoFade set.

      Parameters:
      lifetime - The time the distortion has before it expires.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • getLocation

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f getLocation()
      Returns the current location of the distortion.

      Specified by:
      getLocation in interface DistortionAPI
      Returns:
      The current location of the distortion.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location)
      Sets the desired location of the distortion.

      Parameters:
      location - The desired location of the distortion.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • getRemainingLifetime

      public float getRemainingLifetime()
      Returns the remaining time the distortion has left before it expires. Lifetime does not count down while the distortion is fading (in or out). After reaching the end of its lifetime, the distortion may fade out before disappearing if it has AutoFade set.

      Returns:
      The remaining time the distortion has left before it expires.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • getSize

      public float getSize()
      Returns the apparent size of the distortion, in world-space units.

      Returns:
      The apparent size of the distortion, in world-space units.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • setSize

      public void setSize(float size)

      size - The desired size of the distortion, in world-space units.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • getSprite

      public com.fs.starfarer.api.graphics.SpriteAPI getSprite()
      The sprite used to draw the distortion texture. The red channel corresponds to horizontal distortion vector, while the green channel corresponds to vertical distortion vector. The engine will normalize these values for you. The blue channel corresponds to distortion magnitude. For example, a pure white square as a distortion texture will copy a square of pixels somewhere to the top-right of the screen.

      Specified by:
      getSprite in interface DistortionAPI
      Returns:
      The sprite used to draw the distortion texture.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • getVelocity

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f getVelocity()
      Gets the current velocity of the distortion.

      Returns:
      The current velocity of the distortion.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.2

      public void setVelocity(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity)
      Sets the velocity for the distortion.

      Parameters:

      Since:
      Alpha 1.2

    • isFading

      public boolean isFading()
      Returns whether the distortion is currently fading or not, regardless of how it is fading.

      Returns:
      Whether the distortion is currently fading or not.

      Since:

    • isFlipped

      public boolean isFlipped()
      Whether the distortion should be flipped in magnitude. This simulates the effect of performing a horizontal-vertical inversion of the red and green color channels. For example, if the distortion normally looks like a sphere, it will instead look like a spherical hole.

      Specified by:
      isFlipped in interface DistortionAPI
      Returns:
      Whether the magnitude should be flipped.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.1

    • setArc

      public void setArc(float start, float end)
      Sets the visible arc of the distortion, in degrees. Note: the entire shader is visible if the arc spans 0 degrees.

      Parameters:
      start - The start of the distortion's visible arc, in degrees.
      end - The end of the distortion's visible arc, in degrees.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.11
